meanings.definition: Relating to the study of the biological basis of social behavior.
meanings.sent1: The sociobiological research explained how genes can influence social actions.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use sociobiological theories to understand why animals behave in certain ways.
meanings.sent3: The sociobiological approach to studying friendships in animals led to some unexpected discoveries.
meanings.sent4: Her sociobiological perspective shed light on the hidden motivations behind group dynamics.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made the concept of sociobiological factors in behavior easy to grasp.

meanings.definition: Involving the interaction between biology and social behavior.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the sociobiological aspects of aggression can help prevent conflicts.
meanings.sent2: The sociobiological approach considers how genetics and environment shape social interactions.
meanings.sent3: The sociobiological explanation for cooperation among animals was both fascinating and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The book used a sociobiological analogy to explain the complexities of human relationships.
meanings.sent5: The documentary vividly portrayed the impact of sociobiological factors on group dynamics.
